##After two outbreaks, the small-business owner would rather chase debts than lay off workers

I-CAIJING

CAIJING magazine official Wechat. "CAIJING" magazine, sponsored by the China Securities Market Research Center, was first published in 1998, adhering to the news concept of "independence, exclusiveness and originality" , and is known for authoritative, impartial and professional reporting, it is a must-read publication for policy-makers, researchers and managers in the field of politics and economics.

The following article is from the Financial Mayflower, the author of the financial mayflower

This is the "capital and finance" of CAIJING magazine, focusing on forward-looking, in-depth financial system and market reporting.

Zhou Yongjun, who had planned to lay off workers after the Lunar New Year holiday, reversed his original decision after the outbreak. He believes that businesses also have social attributes, and he places his hopes for survival on debt collection, shrinking inventories, reducing losses, and tax breaks and delays in social security payments

By Zhang Wei, CAIJING correspondent

Editor | Yuen Man

This Spring Festival, Zhou Yongjun finally have time to quiet down to read, study management. "I wish I could be a real entrepreneur, " he says, but he knows that this year's Spring Festival will put off his entrepreneurial dreams for an indeterminate amount of time.

When SARS broke out in 2003, Zhou Yongjun was in Beijing. He had just come to Beijing to seek development because he could not adapt to the slow pace of his hometown. The experience of SARS that year made him look calm in the face of COVID-19 pneumonia this year. "I don't think we can rush in right now because there is too much uncertainty affecting us. "

As an upstream manufacturer, Zhou positions himself as a start-up owner. Currently, he owns two businesses, one for early childhood programming and the other for automation, with a combined workforce of just 50, Zhou said.

Compared with the holiday jitters of many small business owners, Zhou did one thing right last year. He told Caijing that it was more important to be strong than to be big, and if we hadn't made collection our top priority last year, we would be even more miserable right now.

Despite the PRESCIENCE, it's only a matter of postponing the moment of anxiety. Zhou Yongjun admitted that he currently has only three months of funds to sustain his company's expenses. Although it seems rich compared to the one month that many enterprises claim at present, if the epidemic continues to spread, building consumer confidence will take longer in the future, and this "reserve" is a drop in the bucket.

"Try to think how much can a family survive without an income for 3-4 months, " Zhou asked.

Unlike many of the business owners affected by the epidemic who planned to lay off workers years ago, Zhou changed his original decision after the outbreak, "The original idea was to make money on your own, but that's not the case at all. Companies are inherently social. "

"It's not easy for them to find jobs if they don't renew the contract at this time, " Zhou said, still pinning his hopes on outstanding payments. If the money is recovered, his company can survive for a year, but he said it would be a difficult path.

In the face of this epidemic, there are more or less entrepreneurs dream of delayed realization, can not be counted at present, Zhou Yongjun's experience should be just the tip of the iceberg. Yet in the midst of the epidemic, it is rare for business owners to voluntarily abandon plans to lay off workers.

Zhou Yongjun told Caijing that if there is still hope, the country can suspend the implementation of full social security contributions for two years, which is currently a very high cost for small businesses.

Although the scale of enterprises varies from industry to industry, the production service enterprises with dozens of employees can basically be classified into a small range. By the end of 2018, there were 18.07 million legal entities in China, including 2.392 million small and medium enterprises and 15.439 million micro enterprises, accounting for about 80 percent of the total employed population, according to the National Bureau of Statistics of the People's Republic of China.

PRESCIENCE, delayed anxiety

CAIJING: What prompted you to put collection first last year?

Zhou Yongjun: It is the product Operation Cycle. Because the company continued to have new product R & D Investment, money is relatively tight, and earnings are in the future, if the old money will not be up in time, NEW PRODUCT R & D May Fall on the road.

Last year, the best thing we did was put collections first and business second. Moreover, in the industry we have the technology, but also belong to the upstream manufacturers, in all fairness, machinery manufacturers more difficult.

"CAIJING" : At present, the company affected by the epidemic to what extent?

Zhou Yongjun: Our company has two businesses, one is early childhood programming education, including teaching and training and product development, product development is not affected temporarily, but the impact of training schools is relatively large, it is estimated that the end of the epidemic will take a period of time to build consumer confidence; Another business is automation, is the three-dimensional Garage Electronic Control System core product research and development sales, in which the man-machine interface is a larger domestic manufacturers, the biggest impact.

Because we are a national business, affected by the epidemic, all business stopped, the epidemic is expected to end in Wuhan also about a month, but consumer confidence will take at least three months to build, like the engine flameout, it's GonNa take time to reboot. Originally the goal of this year's business is to be able to step up the ladder, now it seems that it must be doomed to failure. As things stand, it would take at least four months for the economy to get back on track, which is ideal. Try to think of how much a family can survive without an income for three to four months.

CAIJING: How much does it affect your cash flow?

Zhou Yongjun: it will take at least four months before the business can form a stable source of funding, and the expenditure between them is rigid, which is equivalent to not in and only out. Small businesses like US need at least four months of cash reserves, and objectively speaking, because the 2019 economic downturn, small businesses are not good, affected by the epidemic for a few months will certainly be more difficult.

At present, the domestic enterprises that can reserve 3 months'expenditure funds are not very many, almost all are in maintenance. If we hadn't made collecting money our top priority last year, we wouldn't be here right now.

CAIJING: Do you have a bank loan?

Zhou Yongjun: Yes, but relatively few. When the education sector increased its research and development, it needed money. It borrowed 1 million yuan. However, our loan belongs to a credit loan. There is no mortgage, so the bank loan is still good. Fortunately, we do not have to deal with, do not owe the suppliers of funds, are receivables.

CAIJING: I can see that you are hoping to get your receivables back. Is this a good way to go?

Zhou Yongjun: Can Increase Collection Dynamics only, pass legal path really not, if walk prosecution path, bad debt is certain to have. Live first, control expenses. Spend what you can, spend what you can't. In an ideal world, there would be no pressure on the company to survive for a year if all the money owed outside was recovered, but that would be impossible.

CAIJING: Why so sure?

Zhou Yongjun: Now the domestic credit is too bad, our loan recovery is not good, otherwise our company development will certainly be very good. In fact, I also know that my clients a year business scale several hundred million, profit is not necessarily a million, the end of last year some customers did not pay a single payment, the normal situation over the new year to pay some. So, even though we're really struggling, I know we're OK, because we have the core technology, and it's said that our industry is less than 5% profitable, and pop-up garages used to be a sunrise industry, but I don't think it's sunrise anymore.

Our customers are stereo garage manufacturers, we provide them (customers) man-machine interface, remote IO, control systems and other products. The loans are customers'loans, there are nearly 20% of the bad debts. In fact, forced harvest is a double-edged sword, certainly can not cooperate in the future, but the domestic situation, can drag on.

CAIJING: Is it true that there is no money, or is it deliberate?

Zhou Yongjun: three-dimensional garage professional upstream manufacturers are real estate, after the state regulation, the overall industrial chain economy has been affected. Some enterprises are really no money, some enterprises are really rich is not to give. Years ago a customer insisted on a car to me, the reason is not to car non-payment, I did not want, really feel too bullying, over the year directly to sue him.

The layoffs have been reversed by the outbreak

"CAIJING" : At present, what is the biggest expense of your enterprise?

Zhou Yongjun: Labor costs, a penny can not be less, when the economy is good wages, when the economy is not good can not be reduced. I can give you an account, my two business, which automation side of the labor costs of 320,000 per month, another business education labor costs of 200,000 per month, look at the whole year, total labor costs are in the neighborhood of $6 million. Moreover, at present the company is in the high investment stage, originally planned after the Spring Festival increases the market sale personnel to expand the market, now looked that has no chance.

CAIJING: Affected by the epidemic, many enterprises are claiming to lay off workers. Do you have a plan?

Zhou Yongjun: There will be some, but not all because of the epidemic. According to my original plan, after the end of a few will not renew, but this is not a good time, after the epidemic. It's hard for them to get a job if they don't renew their contract at this point, and now the idea is that we're all in this together, and we don't have to cut anything. The original idea is that they can make money, now, in fact, is not the case at all, the enterprise is social, with social attributes.

A lot of people advised me to cut back. I was too soft. There's no way our people are going to be able to get jobs like this outside of work. So, stick together and keep warm. Now labor-intensive, low-tech enterprises are the most difficult, especially some small micro-enterprises from the bank loans.

"CAIJING" : Business Normal Operation of the time, tax pressure?

Zhou Yongjun: We belong to the general taxpayer, selling products to pay 13% VAT, for example, we buy 100 raw materials, processing into a product, sales price 500, according to 50 / 50(hardware tax rebate, software tax rebate) look, need to Pay Vat (250-100) / 1.130.1317.2; the software part according to 3% , the remaining tax rebate 250 / 1.130.36.63 yuan, the total plus Vat 10% is (17.2 + 6.63)110% 26.21; the feeling profit has 400-26.21372.5, for example, our labor costs to 400, the actual loss is 26.21 yuan, each situation is different, the hardware part of the tax country is not refundable. As a result, many small businesses, especially labor-intensive ones, would like to see labor costs as a tax credit.

CAIJING: Did you enjoy the dividend of state policy before?

Zhou Yongjun: We are a small enterprise that has received the dividend of the state policy, such as tax refund, rent reduction, etc. . If we do not refund, it is really difficult to do, such as the software part of the product is not refunded, the cost is too high to maintain. As a true micro business owner, I want to say that what micro businesses most need is fairness, if the policy dividend is equal or no one to give, I believe that there will be a batch of Zombie enterprises exit, also conducive to healthy competition.

In fact, the country is not easy, for the enterprise, sometimes give point policy is a small fraction. I personally believe that businesses still need to use the rules of the market to help form a better virtuous circle. Now all businesses are calling for tax relief, if you can reduce rent, tax, of course, but from our industry, business stagnation is no tax, and various social security and provident fund is our very high cost. If business stays stagnant, expect the state to put off paying full social security contributions for two years, or there will be a lot of layoffs.

CAIJING: As a typical representative of small business owners, what advice do you have for your peers during this period?

Zhou Yongjun: I believe that in hard times, there will be many business owners who choose not to lay off workers. Well, from my industry, in the case of no layoffs, can not recruit, the company needs to do a good job of internal structure optimization, compression of inventory, reduce losses. At the same time, improve human efficiency, reduce management costs, so that employees and enterprises to form a community of destiny, under the premise of quality assurance, through a variety of means to reduce costs, such as optimal design.

I am a science and engineering man, under the epidemic let me have time to ponder another question deeply, some people say I am a good boss, but I do not think I am a good manager, a business to develop, good management mechanism is very important, and our company is basically self-conscious.

In fact, there are a lot of small businesses like us in the country, many of which are at a very high level of engagement, and I think, during the epidemic, there was a lot of emotional anxiety, but still, it's important to do something meaningful under the circumstances.

It's also good to read a few management books.

Related:

The epidemic will interrupt China's weak economic stabilisation at the end of 2019. Breaking 6 is a probable event and may break 5 in the first quarter, given the strong downward pressure on the economy, Evergrande Research Institute said in a recent paper. Among them, the largest impact on the medium-sized industries, including: catering, tourism, film, transportation, education and training; The impact on micro-individuals is reflected in: private enterprises, small and micro-enterprises, flexible pay system employees, migrant workers and other more damaged.

In the policy recommendations, the Evergrande Institute stressed that the appropriate reduction or exemption of the first quarter severely affected by the epidemic sectors, especially transport (civil aviation, road passenger transport, water passenger transport and taxi) , tourism, catering, accommodation and other industries, value-added tax, the loss was offset against the profit month to lower the income tax. At the same time, further reduce the social security contribution rate, pension, medical contribution rate can be reduced by 1 and 2 percentage points, reduce the burden on enterprises.

COVID-19
